name: Count the number of occurrences of elements in the string from the 4th index of the string to the end of the string
instruction:
The `countElFrom4Ind` function takes 1 parameter - the string `str`.

The string is of arbitrary length and consists of words in upper or lower case, separated by spaces.

The function returns an object in which the keys are letters and the values are the number of occurrences of these letters.

The counting starts from the 4th index of the string to the end.

Correct the errors in the code to make the function work correctly.

Example of running the function:
```javascript
countElFrom4Ind('REPAPER'); // {E: 1, P: 1, R: 1}
countElFrom4Ind('Love Birds'); // {" ": 1, B: 1, d: 1, i: 1, r: 1, s: 1}
countElFrom4Ind('4 you'); // {u: 1}
countElFrom4Ind('Anna'); // 'The string is not long enough'
countElFrom4Ind('Up'); // 'The string is not long enough'
```
